Class Users

java.lang.Object
  play.mvc.Controller
      controllers.CRUD

              controllers.Users
All Implemented Interfaces:
play.classloading.enhancers.ControllersEnhancer.ControllerSupport, play.classloading.enhancers.LocalvariablesNamesEnhancer.LocalVariablesSupport
public class Users
extends Index

This controller is responsible for keeping track of users, updating their status in the system, assigning them rooms, passing chat requests, etc..

Method Detail

login

public static void login(java.lang.Long facebook_id,
                         java.lang.String name,
                         java.lang.String access_token,
                         java.lang.String avatar,
                         java.lang.String alias,
                         java.lang.String callback)
Log user with facebook_id into the system. Using access_token, contact the Facebook API and download their latest set of friends. Check current online users for matches, and return the set of friends who are online. In the list of friends is included a mapping of -1 => chatroom server; this is the server the requesting client should login to

Parameters:
facebook_id - the facebook id of the user logging in
name - the name to assign to the user logging in
access_token - an up to date access_token for logging into the facebook API
avatar - optional, url of an avatar to display for this user
alias - optional, an alias for this user
callback - optional, required for cross-doman requests

                          java.lang.String callback)
Mark this user as offline

Parameters:
facebook_id -
callback - optional JSONP callback

random

public static void random(java.lang.Long user_id,
                          java.lang.String callback)
Return a random user to chat with

Parameters:
user_id - your user_id, so the random returned user isn't you
callback - optional JSONP callback

requestRandomRoom

public static void requestRandomRoom(java.lang.Long user_id,
                                     java.lang.String callback)
For super hero chat, indicate you are ready to start chatting. Someone else will be paired with you immediately if they are available, or whenever they do become available

Parameters:
user_id - your user_id, so the random returned user isn't you
callback - optional JSONP callback

leaveRoom

public static void leaveRoom(java.lang.Long user_id,
                             java.lang.Long room_id,
                             java.lang.String callback)
Remove a user from a room, and notify other participants they left

Parameters:
user_id - the user to remove from the room
room_id - the room to remove them from
callback - optional JSONP callback
